name: askew

not straight or level: Isn't that picture slightly askew? My hat was askew so I adjusted it in the mirror. Synonyms
awry
cockeyed (SLOPING) informal
lopsided
skew-whiff UK informal
wonky (NOT FIRM/LEVEL/REGULAR) mainly UK informal
More examplesFewer examplesHe reaches to straighten the only book in her home office that's slightly askew. A desk chair was tipped on its side, a trash can was overturned, and a rug was askew. A slightly askew painting on the Carlsons' living room wall is testimony to the traffic overhead.

in or into a position in which something is not straight or level: He held his helmet askew to conceal his injuries. Foundations can crack and buildings can sink or tip askew.
More examplesFewer examplesHer long black head scarf shifts slightly askew as she glares disapprovingly at her daughter.One column on the exterior dome was knocked askew by the earthquake.Traffic wardens look for anything out of order - a truck parked askew or a car that hasn't moved in a while.
